That's correct. 4 Q. Now, your recollection is that Ghislaine generally worked out of Epstein's offices in New York; isn't that right? 5 A. Yes. 6 Q. And you testified there was a room in Epstein's offices that had about five desks in it that was sort of off to the right of his office? 7 A. That's correct. 8 Q. And that's what you called the personal assistants' room; right? 9 A. There was no official name for it, but it was my best description of who was in that room. 10 Q. And Ghislaine was one of the personal assistants who had a desk in that room? 11 A. That's correct. 12 Q. Now, when you first met Ghislaine in 1991, she seemed to you to be just an employee of Epstein; isn't that right? 13 A. It might in the first introduction. 14 Q. So at that point early on, I'm talking '91, '92 when you first started working, it didn't seem to you like she had a personal relationship with Epstein; right? 15 A. No. I believe when Mr. Epstein introduced her, that he SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017494
